key_differences: Adds Association Set Provider (ASP) compliance layer
Allows users to prove funds are not from illicit sources
Users can choose compliance curators (from 'Strict OFAC' to 'community-vetted')
Non-custodial ragequit function if deposit fails screening
tornado_cash_relationship.research_origins: Based on 2023 research paper co-authored by Vitalik Buterin, Ameen Soleimani, Jacob Illum (Chainalysis), Matthias Nadler, and Fabian Schar

auditors.name: Oxorio
auditors.findings_summary: Identified critical and major vulnerabilities that required fixes before deployment. Team was responsive and addressed all issues.

compliance_mechanisms: Association Set Provider (ASP) - compliance layer screening deposits
Know Your Transaction (KYT) service for vetting fund sources
Blacklist of 16,000+ addresses linked to illicit activity
tornado_cash_differences.fund_safety: Non-custodial design with ragequit function for rejected deposits

security_features: Merkle tree (Lean IMT) for commitment tracking

mixer_mechanics.deposit_process: Users deposit publicly, funds screened by ASP
mixer_mechanics.withdrawal_process: Users generate zero-knowledge membership proofs to withdraw privately
mixer_mechanics.proof_of_association: Core compliance primitive - cryptographic proof that funds belong to pre-vetted 'Association Set' of compliant transactions
mixer_mechanics.anonymity_set: Users prove membership without revealing specific deposit

supported_chains.v2_features: Shielded pool for internal p2p payments, swaps, multisig, yield (planned ETHCC March 2026)

association_set_provider.description: Off-chain compliance layer that screens deposits and monitors transactions in real-time
association_set_provider.function: Blockchain forensics check that deposited funds aren't linked to hacks or sanctioned entities

know_your_transaction.description: KYT service vets source of funds, not user identity
know_your_transaction.approach: Doesn't care who you are, only cares where money has been

user_selectable_curators.description: Users decide which compliance curators to trust

tornado_cash_proof_of_association.description: Tool allowing existing Tornado Cash users to dissociate funds from illicit activity
tornado_cash_proof_of_association.status: First working mechanism reconciling privacy with compliance on Tornado Cash

institutional_backing.ethereum_foundation_integration: Privacy Pools integrated into Ethereum Foundation's Kohaku wallet (demonstrated at Cypherpunk Congress, Devconnect Buenos Aires)

tornado_cash_context.tc_sanction_reason: Alleged role in laundering billions including Lazarus Group funds
tornado_cash_context.tc_sanction_reversal: November 2024 - US appeals court ruled immutable smart contracts don't qualify as seizable property
tornado_cash_context.0xbow_differentiation: Designed from ground up for compliance while preserving privacy

founders.name: Ameen Soleimani
founders.background: Iranian-American software engineer, ConsenSys alumni, SpankChain founder/CEO, MolochDAO summoner, Reflexer Finance (RAI stablecoin), IranUnchained humanitarian efforts

summary.project_description: 0xBow is a privacy infrastructure project that implements Privacy Pools - a compliant, zero-knowledge-based privacy protocol for Ethereum. It is a forked successor to Tornado Cash that adds an Association Set Provider (ASP) compliance layer, allowing users to prove their funds are not associated with illicit activity without revealing transaction details.
summary.key_innovation: Reconciles blockchain privacy with regulatory compliance through zero-knowledge proofs combined with blockchain forensics screening (KYT), enabling legal anonymous transactions

risk_assessment.technical_risk: Low - Well-audited (4 audits), uses proven cryptographic primitives (Groth16, Poseidon), professional codebase with extensive testing
risk_assessment.regulatory_risk: Low - Designed for compliance, not sanctioned, integrated by Ethereum Foundation, backed by major VCs including Coinbase Ventures
risk_assessment.adoption_risk: Medium - Still early with $6M volume and 1,500 users, but growing with institutional backing

research_gaps: Specific details of all audit findings not publicly available (only summary)
Exact test coverage percentage not disclosed
L2 deployment timeline for Optimism/Arbitrum/Polygon not confirmed
Privacy Pools V2 shielded pool specifications pending
